definition: To reduce in amount, degree, or intensity
example: The storm finally began to abate after three hours.

definition: Departing from the normal or expected
example: His aberrant behavior worried his friends.

definition: To regard with disgust and hatred
example: She abhors violence in any form.

definition: To leave hurriedly and secretly to avoid detection
example: The thief absconded with the money.

definition: Not self-indulgent, especially in eating and drinking
example: His abstemious habits kept him healthy.

definition: An award or privilege granted as a special honor
example: The scientist received many accolades for her work.

definition: The ability to make good judgments quickly
example: Her business acumen made her successful.
He was adamant that they leave immediately.

definition: To warn or reprimand someone firmly
example: The teacher admonished the students for cheating.
She was adroit at handling difficult customers.
The building had great aesthetic appeal.

definition: Friendly and easy to talk to
example: The affable host made everyone feel welcome.
She accepted the challenge with alacrity.
The medicine alleviated her pain.
Her altruistic actions helped many people.

definition: Open to more than one interpretation
example: His ambiguous answer confused everyone.
She felt ambivalent about the job offer.
The new policy ameliorated working conditions.

definition: Having a friendly and pleasant manner
example: He was an amiable companion on the trip.

definition: Belonging to a different time period
example: Using a typewriter seems anachronistic today.

definition: Something that deviates from what is normal
example: The warm December weather was an anomaly.
She felt antipathy toward dishonesty.
Voter apathy led to low election turnout.

definition: To pacify someone by giving in to demands
example: He tried to appease his angry boss.

definition: Based on random choice rather than reason
example: The decision seemed arbitrary and unfair.

definition: Known or understood by very few; mysterious
example: The ritual involved arcane symbols.
The arduous hike lasted six hours.

definition: Having the ability to speak fluently
example: She was an articulate public speaker.

definition: Practicing severe self-discipline and avoiding indulgence
example: The monk led an ascetic lifestyle.

definition: To make something unpleasant less intense
example: He tried to assuage her fears.

definition: Having the ability to accurately assess situations
example: Her astute observations helped solve the case.

definition: Showing a willingness to take bold risks
example: His audacious plan shocked everyone.

definition: Severe or strict in manner; without luxury
example: The room had an austere appearance.
His avarice led to his downfall.
The movie's plot was disappointingly banal.
His belligerent attitude ruined the discussion.
The benevolent king cared for his people.
The doctor confirmed the tumor was benign.
The evidence bolstered their argument.
His bombastic speech failed to impress.

definition: Concise and exact use of words
example: The brevity of her speech was appreciated.
His callous remarks hurt her feelings.
I appreciate your candid feedback.

definition: Given to sudden changes of mood
example: The capricious weather ruined our plans.
The coach castigated the team for poor effort.

definition: Something that causes an important event
example: The scandal was the catalyst for reform.
Her caustic comments were hurtful.
The senator was censured for misconduct.

definition: A person falsely claiming special knowledge
example: The supposed healer was a charlatan.

definition: Wary and unwilling to take risks
example: She was circumspect about the investment.

definition: To come together to form one mass
example: The groups coalesced into a movement.

definition: To persuade someone using force or threats
example: They were coerced into signing.
She made a cogent argument.
He gave a coherent explanation.
Don't be complacent about security.

definition: Giving information clearly in few words
example: Please provide a concise summary.
His condescending tone was insulting.

definition: To accept behavior that is considered wrong
example: The school doesn't condone bullying.

definition: Causing or likely to cause argument
example: Taxes are always a contentious issue.
The plot twist felt contrived.
She spoke with great conviction.
She took copious notes.

definition: To confirm or support with evidence
example: The witness corroborated his story.
She gave a credible explanation.
The credulous child believed everything.
He left a cryptic message.
He gave it only a cursory glance.
She became cynical after the scandal.
The challenge didn't daunt her.
The launch was a complete debacle.

definition: To put off to a later time
example: We deferred the decision until Monday.
The child gave a defiant look.
It was a deliberate lie.
The report delineates the problems.
Her calm demeanor was reassuring.
They denounced the violence.
The painting depicts a sunset.
Critics derided the plan.

definition: In low spirits from loss of hope
example: He was despondent after the loss.
The alarm deters burglars.
Smoking is detrimental to health.
The room was devoid of furniture.
The story has a didactic tone.

definition: Modest or shy from lack of confidence
example: She was diffident about her abilities.
The dilapidated building collapsed.

definition: A difficult choice between two options
example: She faced a moral dilemma.
She was a diligent student.
It was hard to discern the truth.
Please be discreet about this.

definition: The feeling that something is unworthy
example: She looked at him with disdain.

definition: To regard as being of little worth
example: Don't disparage his efforts.
There's a disparity in wages.

definition: To hold opinions that differ from official ones
example: One judge dissented.

definition: To persuade someone not to do something
example: I tried to dissuade him from quitting.
The paths diverge at the river.

definition: Showing a great deal of variety
example: The city has a diverse population.
The horse was surprisingly docile.

definition: Laying down principles as absolutely true
example: She was dogmatic in her beliefs.
